The Consumer Financial Protection Bureau: s mission is to "protect consumers by carrying out federal consumer financial laws" and includes enforcing consumer financial protection laws, following up on consumer complaints, promoting financial education, conducting research on consumer behavior, and monitoring financial markets for risks.
The bureau is controversial and has face: including blocking the appointment of Elizabeth Warren and delaying the confirmation of Richard Cordray.
Unlike most federal agencies: the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau does not rely on appropriations for its funding and instead receives its operating budget from the Federal Reserve.
The bureau is designed to be unfettered: both congressional and otherwise, in order to limit influence from the financial sector it oversees.
